intro: Cassia tenuissima, commonly known as sicklepod, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its seed pods are slender and curved, giving it the common name "sicklepod." Cassia tenuissima is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some regions.
